title: Farming Matters: Forcing Belgian Endive and Treviso Radicchio in The Upper Midwest with Peter Skold

tasks.task: Planting and growing Belgian endive and Treviso radicchio.
subtasks: Planting chicories in the field during mid-summer or early July.
Weeding and watering the chicory plants as they grow.
Harvesting the roots using an undercutter bar and trimming the greens.
Storing the roots in a walk-in cooler with high humidity.
Transplanting the roots into a dark room or forcing chamber.
Monitoring water levels and ensuring no light reaches the roots during forcing.
Harvesting forced chicory after three weeks for radicchio and six weeks for endive.
Trimming and cleaning the harvested roots before packaging.

tasks.task: Marketing and selling the forced chicory.
subtasks: Targeting specialty restaurants for high-value sales.
Educating customers about the unique taste and story behind the product.
Feeding roots to livestock for alternative use.
Exploring potential for roasting chicory roots as a coffee substitute.
Considering the possibility of brewing chicory into stouts or porters.
